intro: Astiella confusa, commonly known as the confused astiella, is a rare and little-studied plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Astiella confusa is considered a vulnerable species.
